Grid

The grid-mixin allows you to specify a number of columns a container should occupy.

The grid is fully responsive: resize your browser to check how it behaves at different breakpoints.

Note that since Skeletal is based entirely on em-values, you can only safely apply this mixin to elements with a font-size of 1em.

Floating containers

The $break-every-nth-parameter floats element with the same class and clears the floating after every nth element: 

.item {
  @include grid(4, $break-every-nth: 3);
}

Grid offset

The $offset-attribute allows you to move a container to the left by a number of columns. With additional floating, you can easily achieve a layout such as the following:

grid(6, $offset: 1)

grid(3, $offset: 1)

grid(4, $offset: 2)

grid(3, $offset: 2)

Breakpoint-aware media queries

This is the most amazing feature.

Number of columns

You can set the $number-of-grid-columns-variable in _config.scss to 12, 16 or 24.

Changes to this variable have a direct effect on the widths the grid-mixin calculates.
